Passage:
Regulations to implement the standard for automatic exchange of financial account information developed by the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) .
Date of Enactment: 9 July 2017
The Board of Directors of the Abu Dhabi Global Market, in exercise of its powers under Article 6(1) of Law No. 4 of 2013 concerning the Abu Dhabi Global Market issued by His Highness the Ruler of the Emirate of Abu Dhabi, hereby enacts the following Regulations–
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Due Diligence**: Conduct due diligence procedures to identify the tax residency of account holders and controlling persons of entity account holders."
Obligation:2 "Reporting**: Report financial account information of reportable accounts to the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA)."
Obligation:3 "Record-Keeping**: Maintain records of the due diligence and reporting for a specified period, typically at least five years."

Obligation:4 "Registration and Notification**:
   - Register with the FSRA or the relevant authority as a reporting financial institution.
   - Notify account holders about the obligations under the CRS and the possibility of their information being reported to tax authorities."
Obligation:5 "Compliance Program**: Implement and maintain a compliance program, including training staff and establishing internal policies and procedures."
Obligation:6 "Data Protection**: Ensure that personal data collected for CRS purposes is protected in accordance with applicable data protection regulations."
Obligation:7 "Certification**: Provide certifications and declarations as required by the regulatory authority regarding CRS compliance."
Obligation:8 "Penalties for Non-Compliance**: Understand and be aware of the penalties for non-compliance, which may include financial penalties, sanctions, or other enforcement actions."

Passage: Introduction
Definitions

In these Regulations capitalised terms will bear the meaning given to them in the Common Reporting Standard, unless otherwise defined below or the context otherwise requires.

/Table Start
ADGM	means the Abu Dhabi Global Market.
ADGM Court	means the Abu Dhabi Global Market court of first instance established under Abu Dhabi Law No. 4 of 2013.
ADGM Financial Institution	Means: (i) any Financial Institution that is resident in the ADGM, but excludes any branch of that Financial Institution that is located outside of the ADGM; and (ii) any branch of a Financial Institution that is not resident in the ADGM, if that branch is located in the ADGM.
Cabinet Resolution	means the UAE’s Cabinet of Ministers Resolution No. 93 of 2021 Implementing Certain Provisions of the Multilateral Administrative Agreement for Automatic Exchange of Information, as may be amended or superseded from time to time.
Common Reporting Standard	means the standard for automatic exchange of financial account information developed by the OECD as implemented in the UAE, currently set out in the ‘Automatic Exchange of Financial Account Information Regulations’ attached to the Guidance notes for the Common Reporting Standard dated 3 August 2020 issued by the UAE Competent Authority, as may be amended or superseded from time to time.
Designated Officer	means any person, or delegate of that person, appointed by the Regulatory Authority pursuant to the provisions of subsection 5(3).
Government 	means the federal government of the UAE.
OECD	means the Organisation for Economic Co-Operation and Development which was established by the Convention on the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development signed in Paris on 14th December 1960.
Regulatory Authority	means the ADGM Financial Services Regulatory Authority.
Reporting Financial Institution	Means any ADGM Financial Institution that is not a Non-Reporting Financial Institution.
UAE	means the United Arab Emirates.

/Table End

Obligation:10 "Reporting Obligations**: Maintain ongoing reporting to the FSRA about the matters under investigation or related compliance matters, and report any uncovered wrongdoing to the FSRA and potentially other authorities."

Passage: Reporting and Record keeping
Collecting and reporting information
Each Reporting Financial Institution shall collect and report all information in accordance with the Common Reporting Standard, the Cabinet Resolution and these Regulations.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Conduct Due Diligence**: Identify reportable accounts by conducting due diligence procedures to determine the tax residency of account holders and controlling persons of passive non-financial entities."

Obligation:2 "Collect Data**: Gather relevant information on reportable accounts, including the account holder's name, address, tax identification number (TIN), date of birth (for individuals), jurisdiction(s) of tax residence, account number, and financial information such as account balances, interest, dividends, and other income paid or credited to the account."
Obligation:3 "Maintain Records**: Keep records of due diligence actions and collected information for the minimum period specified by the regulations."

Obligation:4 "Report Information**: Submit the collected information to the ADGM's Financial Services Regulatory Authority (FSRA) or the designated authority within the prescribed timeframe, on an annual basis."

Obligation:5 "Implement a Compliance Program**: Develop and maintain a compliance program to ensure adherence to CRS, Cabinet Resolution, and ADGM regulations, including staff training, internal audits, and remediation of deficiencies."
Obligation:6 "Register with Authorities**: Register with the FSRA or the appropriate authority as a Reporting Financial Institution, as required."

Obligation:7 "Notify Account Holders**: Inform non-reportable account holders that their information will not be reported, and notify the FSRA of your status as a Reporting Financial Institution and whether you have reportable accounts."
Obligation:8 "Ensure Data Protection**: Handle personal data in compliance with data protection laws and regulations to protect individual privacy."
Obligation:9 "Cooperate with Authorities**: Respond promptly to requests for additional information from the FSRA or other competent authorities."

Obligation:10 "Understand Penalties**: Be aware of the penalties for non-compliance, including fines, sanctions, or other enforcement actions, and take steps to avoid them.

It is essential to refer to the specific ADGM regulations, the UAE Cabinet Resolution, and the CRS documentation for detailed requirements and to seek legal or professional advice if necessary."

Every Reporting Financial Institution shall keep records of the steps undertaken and any evidence relied upon for the performance of the due diligence procedures and the measures to obtain those records that the Reporting Financial Institution obtains or creates for the purpose of complying with the Common Reporting Standard, the Cabinet Resolution and these Regulations.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Perform Due Diligence Procedures**: Carry out due diligence to identify reportable accounts and determine the tax residency of account holders in line with the CRS and the Cabinet Resolution."

   - Documentation of procedures to identify tax residency.
   - Actions taken to determine reportability of accounts.

   - Correspondence regarding CRS compliance."

Obligation:3 "Retain Evidence**: Preserve all evidence relied upon during due diligence, such as:

Obligation:4 "Ensure Record Accessibility**: Organize and store records to be easily retrievable for review by regulatory authorities."
Obligation:5 "Adhere to Retention Period**: Retain records for the period specified by ADGM regulations (typically a minimum number of years post the relevant period)."

Obligation:9 "Regularly Review and Update Practices**: Continuously review and revise due diligence and record-keeping practices to align with regulatory changes."

(b)	does not do an act or thing that is required or directed to do under these Regulations, the Common Reporting Standard or the Cabinet Resolution; or
(c)	otherwise contravenes these Regulations, the Common Reporting Standard or the Cabinet Resolution,
commits a contravention of these Regulations and the Cabinet Resolution and is liable to the penalties and sanctions set out in the Cabinet Resolution, and any other penalty or administrative fee or sanction that may be imposed by the Regulatory Authority pursuant to subsection 8(1)(a).
Obligations:
Obligation:1 "Compliance with Regulations and Standards:**
   - Comply with all requirements set out in the ADGM regulations, the CRS, and the Cabinet Resolution, including due diligence and reporting obligations."

Obligation:2 "Due Diligence:**
   - Conduct due diligence procedures to identify reportable accounts.
   - Obtain self-certifications from account holders when required.
   - Keep records of due diligence actions taken and information obtained."

Obligation:3 "Reporting:**
   - Report required information on reportable accounts to the ADGM's Regulatory Authority within the prescribed time frame.
   - Ensure reported information is accurate and complete."

Obligation:4 "Prohibition of Certain Acts:**
   - Refrain from any acts prohibited under the ADGM regulations, the CRS, or the Cabinet Resolution, such as facilitating tax evasion."

Obligation:5 "Mandatory Actions:**
   - Perform any acts required or directed under the ADGM regulations, the CRS, or the Cabinet Resolution, including responding to requests for information."

Obligation:6 "Avoidance of Contraventions:**
   - Avoid any action or inaction that contravenes the ADGM regulations, the CRS, or the Cabinet Resolution."

Obligation:7 "Penalties and Sanctions:**
   - Understand the penalties and sanctions for non-compliance as outlined in the Cabinet Resolution and by the Regulatory Authority."

Obligation:8 "Engagement with Regulatory Authority:**
   - Cooperate with the Regulatory Authority during investigations or compliance checks and provide requested information timely and accurately."

Obligation:9 "Record Keeping:**
   - Maintain comprehensive records of all actions taken and documents obtained for compliance, for the period specified by the regulations."

Obligation:10 "Notification of Changes:**
    - Notify the Regulatory Authority of any changes in circumstances that affect reporting obligations or previously reported information."

Obligation:11 "Training and Policies:**
    - Implement internal policies, procedures, and training to ensure staff compliance with the ADGM regulations, the CRS, and the Cabinet Resolution."

Obligation:12 "Regular Review and Update:**
    - Regularly review and update compliance procedures to ensure ongoing adherence to regulations and standards."

Obligation:13 "Seek Professional Advice:**
    - If necessary, seek professional legal or compliance advice to ensure a comprehensive understanding of obligations.

These action items are designed to ensure that Account Holders, Controlling Persons, and Financial Institutions within the ADGM comply with their legal obligations under the relevant regulations and standards."

Passage: Any appeal against any penalty or fee or sanction imposed pursuant to subsection 9(1) must be raised pursuant to the relevant provisions of the Cabinet Resolution.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Review the Cabinet Resolution**: Obtain and thoroughly review the Cabinet Resolution relevant to the appeal process for penalties or sanctions imposed under subsection 9(1)."
Obligation:2 "Timely Filing**: File your appeal within the specified time frame outlined in the Cabinet Resolution to avoid dismissal of your appeal."

Obligation:3 "Proper Procedure**: Adhere to the procedural steps for filing an appeal as detailed in the Cabinet Resolution, including submitting a written notice of appeal, a statement of grounds, and any supporting evidence or documentation."
Obligation:4 "Payment of Fees**: Pay any fees required for filing the appeal as stipulated by the Cabinet Resolution."
Obligation:5 "Legal Representation**: Decide whether to represent yourself or to seek legal representation to assist with the appeal process."
Obligation:6 "Compliance with Procedures**: Follow all procedural requirements during the appeal, which may include attending hearings and submitting additional documentation."
Obligation:7 "Grounds for Appeal**: Clearly articulate the reasons for your appeal, providing evidence or legal arguments as necessary."
Obligation:8 "Await the Decision**: Wait for the decision from the relevant authority and be prepared to comply with it."
Obligation:9 "Compliance with Decisions**: Comply with the final decision of the appellate body, whether it upholds, modifies, or overturns the original penalty, fee, or sanction."
Obligation:10 "Continued Compliance**: Continue to comply with all other regulatory requirements not directly affected by the appeal."

Obligation:11 "Further Actions**: If the appeal is unsuccessful and you believe there has been an error in the decision-making process, consider seeking further review or additional legal action as permitted by the regulations and laws."
Obligation:12 "Consult Legal Expertise**: Consider consulting with a legal expert or compliance professional for tailored advice based on the full context of your situation."

Obligation:7 "Cooperate with the Regulatory Authority**: Cooperate during investigations and when taking corrective actions, including providing access to records, information, and personnel."
Obligation:8 "Meet Deadlines**: Comply with any deadlines set by the Regulatory Authority for taking required actions."
Obligation:9 "Prevent Future Contraventions**: Implement ongoing monitoring and preventive measures to ensure future compliance."
Obligation:10 "Understand and Pay Penalties**: Be aware of and fulfill obligations to pay any fines or penalties if applicable."
Obligation:11 "Seek Professional Advice**: Consult with legal and compliance professionals to fully understand and meet obligations under the notice and regulatory framework."

Unless it can be shown that it acted in bad faith, neither the Regulatory Authority, its delegate, nor any Designated Officer can be held liable for any act, attempted act or omission in the performance, purported non-performance or non-performance of its functions in connection with these Regulations.
Obligations: Obligation:1 "Compliance with Regulations**: Adhere to all applicable regulations, rules, guidelines, and directives issued by the ADGM Regulatory Authority."
Obligation:2 "Good Faith Interactions**: Engage with the Regulatory Authority, its delegate, and any Designated Officer in a manner that is honest and demonstrates good faith."
Obligation:3 "Cooperation**: Cooperate with the Regulatory Authority and its officers during their performance of duties, including inquiries, investigations, or audits."
Obligation:4 "Reporting and Disclosure**: Provide accurate and timely reports and disclosures as required by ADGM regulations."
Obligation:5 "Record Keeping**: Maintain proper and comprehensive records of all activities and transactions as mandated by the ADGM regulations."

Obligation:8 "Legal Advice**: Consider seeking legal advice to fully understand your obligations under ADGM regulations and the implications of the indemnity clause.

These Regulations become effective on date of enactment, except in respect of the following where they shall apply retrospectively:

Obligations:

   - Apply due diligence requirements retrospectively for Pre-existing Accounts from 31 December 2016.
   - Implement due diligence requirements for New Accounts from 1 January 2017."

Obligation:2 "Review and Update Information:**
   - Review all Pre-existing Accounts to ensure compliance with the due diligence standards.
   - Update customer identification information and verify sources of funds as necessary.
   - Conduct risk assessments for both Pre-existing and New Accounts."

   - Maintain records of due diligence performed on all accounts as per regulatory requirements.
